metadata.title: CVE-2019-2182 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in the kernel MMU code there is a possible executionpath leaving some kernel text and rodata pages writable. This could lead tolocal escalation of privilege with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2182` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92').
linux-hwe package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67').
